title: Will we ever get individual Splash Arts Again??

embed.description: This afternoon's red post collection includes details on the upcoming Team Up week and Pool Party event where the community as a whole will unlock various rewards by playing with friends and gifting, a look at the June 11th patch update, tips from Foxdrop on how to optimize your jungle clear, and more!

body:
Lemme start this by saying I'm an avid follower of surrender@20. That being said the last two patches, with both the prehistoric and pool party skins I've logged on hoping for individual splash arts and been disappointed. 

It's not that the splash's look bad, it's just that they look a bit too crammed. Like "OH we have to fit 5 champs in here so we'll scrunch them all in the art in a way that doesn't really allow any of the champs to have a cool setting that caters to them." 

And it's not even like you always did this, the old pool party skins or even last years winter wonderland skins all had individual splash arts. 

I understand that it's cheaper for riot but I really hope that that's not the main reason for this. So I guess the question is will we ever get cool individual splash arts for champions or will we always get groups from now on.

replies.body: Draven's freaking riding Rek'Sai. It's worth it.
Theme skins that are released together should have share splashes in my honest opinion.

Hiya! 

The short answer to this is yes! There will absolutely be solo splash art in the future. 

We felt the Pool Party combined splash was a cool way to incorporate the pool party theme, and really tie everyone together. This gives everyone a bit more personality than if they were alone. For example, Draven is riding Rek'Sai, Zac's spitting water at Lulu's Polymorph, Mundo is rockin' out, and Lulu is splashing around. If these were to be done individually, they would likely lose some of the personality that's captured in this group splash. 

That said, we've been more careful in ensuring that each champion has their space so to speak and get their time to shine in the splash (heh, no pun intended here).

Money isn't a factor here, and we wouldn't put skins together in a splash if it didn't make sense - i.e. they didn't share a similar thematic. We wouldn't put a Mecha skin with a Lunar Revel skin.

Oh, and finally, it's a pool party! Having a party alone isn't nearly as fun as it is with friends! :]

Thanks for the response KateyKhaos! And I want to say that I appreciate that you always respond to questions about skins because I've seen you're a pretty active rioter on here.

Anyway I guess to clarify I meant more solo for group ones like the lunar revel skins. Jinx, Nidalee, Etc... all could have been in the same skin but weren't. And I don't even know if they are a group because they have different prefixes. Those were really cool and since then we've had only group splashes for themes.

Thanks again though for stopping by! I really appreciate it!

> Oh, and finally, it's a pool party! Having a party alone isn't nearly as fun as it is with friends! :]


well that's also what was fun about the old poolparty skin, they showed other champ in the splash who didn't need to have a skin to be there.
Those new group splash are great for stuff like band, robber, "card secret club", gardian and all the small faction fantasy.
But, as you said, poolparty demand a lot of poeple to be good, here if the final splash is the pic in the event news for all the skin, it look more like a 5 friend vacation than a really big party :(

It just feels like Riot is just trying to spit out skins as fast as they can without taking time to delicately capture each champion's personalty in the skins (scenarios). The other people in the post came up with very logical counter arguments about how last year Pool party skins were EPIC a sexy Leona laying on a nice beach (Which isn't saying Pool Party at all.) having her OWN splash art FEATURING other champions in MINOR ROLES who don't have a skin. Showing that she's not having Beach Party all by herself. "Having a party alone isn't nearly as fun as it is with friends!"

I do find combining skins acceptable when its the SEASON Champion team that won because that makes sense why would they not share a splash art.
Pentakill is also reasonable but still you could show the scene in different angles and give the other champions MINOR roles in the background and give Sona a MAJOR SOLO!
Soccer Team, Kinda reasonable can't see other ways of making it work.


All I'm saying being as long term summoner and an  being inspired by all your splashes which DRIVED ME TO BECOME A BETTER ARTIST it's a blow to my heart{{item:3110}}  when I see you guys do this. Nothing is wrong with spliting them up either it's easy to make them EXIST without having to completely share their spotlight you guys know this. please try to obstain from this I see the bilgewater skins come out. The Twisted Fate with Gangplank the duo looks awesome not gonna lie they least have enough space in their splash art to seem SOMEWHAT INDIVIDUALIZE. 

another thing that slightly bothers me is that the consistency of GP's new splash art it only portrays half his body. WHILE ALL of the OTHER CHAMPS DISPLAY THE WHOLE FIGURE!!!! just seems like a good tease but if you're going for consistency and clarity this isnt the way.

wait, does this mean that you guys are against having robot blood moon skins? poor ori, blitz, rumble, and vik.
=P

Katey, some of those skins are 1350.

They DESERVE their own splashes.

And Katey, Zac deserves HIS OWN splash. All this waiting to have him on the left slightly off frame? Cmon Katey. I get the party ideal, but individual splashes allow you to tease even more champs. There was the old full pool party picture that teased Jinx, then each with individual splashes.

Why can't you do that? Because I'm sorry, some of these prices deserve their own splashes.

I'm so conflicted on this issue. I like that most skins have their own unique splash where they can just look awesome and do their Thang

But at the same time I love things like the High Stakes splash, where it's just cool to see them in a group doing something. (Whatever it is those guys are doing, it's cool) a shame we can't have both!
they give cheap skins shared splashes. Champion splashes are always individual, as are expensive skins.
Some of the skins are 1350 which I wouldn't say falls into the cheap category...

I had the same reaction when I saw that splash *pun*. 

I though, aren't Zac and Rek'Sai 1350 skins? Rek'sai has someone riding on her back which takes up a lot of her visual space, and Zac goes off frame and isn't even 100% in the picture. Seems a bit unfair to me.

And the focus of the image is Mundo and Lulu, which to me are the least interesting of the new pool party skins.

This is supposed to be Zac's big skin debut that everyone's been waiting forever for, but the splash is so uninspiring.
I'm tired of shared splash art but you have to admit, Draven riding on top of Rek'Sai is pretty badass.
I like the whole groups concept, makes a lot of sense. As for the champion choices, I think it would have been better to see a  pool party urgot.

The new Irelia skin, new Trynd, and many others haven't had shared splashes.  The way they're using the shared splashes is actually fine, it's for themed sets that they are releasing together.  It'll probably go back to individual skins after the pool party set.

Yes......if there's no theme sharing on the same patch.
If several champs receive skins that share a theme on the same patch,regardless of price they will have a shared splash art.Riot clearly is going down this route now.

The only way a skin will get an individual splash is if that's the only skin of that theme coming out in that patch.For example,if it was JUST Pool Party {{champion:154}} this patch & no other Pool Party skins,then we would have received an individual splash for just Zac.

The only reason shared splashed are becoming more prevalent is because we're getting a lot skins that share a theme each patch which results in a lot more shared splashes.

Let's not act like we're not getting individual splashes anymore.Star Guardian Lux,Knockout Lee Sin,Order of the Lotus Irelia,Nightmare Tryndamere,these skins were alone with their theme.
